River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crow of hybrid tragedies over complicates the film into confusion. I found myself confused and frustrated and wishing I owned a microscope and was looking through to the ever so slight lines between the light and dark components of the film and thought some holes might offer a gate-way into a bonus feature on the DVD.
